description: All 34 player-initiated decisions from Camp Hub menu

events.title: Rest
events.setup: Your legs ache from the march and your eyes burn from too many watches. A soldier learns to grab sleep wherever he can find it.

options.text: Find a shady spot and steal what rest you can.
options.resultText: You wedge yourself between supply crates, cloak bundled as a pillow. The camp noise fades. When you stir, the shadows have moved but you feel lighter.

options.text: Rest near the fire with the other soldiers.
options.resultText: You doze at the fire's edge, half-listening to the men's talk. Not deep sleep, but the company keeps the darker thoughts at bay.

options.text: Push through. Sleep is for the garrison.
options.resultText: You shake off the weariness. The campaign waits for no man's comfort.

events.title: Extended Rest
events.setup: You need real sleep, not just a nap. A full night's rest would do wonders, but you'd be unavailable for a while.

options.text: Find your bedroll and get proper sleep.
options.resultText: You sleep deeply and wake feeling like a new man. Your body thanks you for the rest.

options.text: I can sleep when I'm dead.
options.resultText: You push through the exhaustion. Sleep can wait.

events.title: Seek Treatment
events.setup: The surgeon's tent. Time to deal with your wounds properly. It'll cost coin, but proper care prevents worse problems.

options.resultText: The surgeon cleans and binds your wounds with practiced hands. It stings like hell, but you'll heal clean.

options.text: Just the basics - bandages and salve. (10 gold)
options.resultText: Basic supplies change hands. It's not fancy, but it helps.
You leave the surgeon's tent. Time and luck will have to do the work.

events.title: Weapon Drill
events.setup: Practice forms with the training posts. Basic work, but it builds muscle memory.

options.resultText: Swing, block, thrust, recover. You run through the forms until your arms burn. It's honest work.
The training posts will be there tomorrow.

events.title: Sparring Match
events.setup: The drill ground is busy. A few soldiers are working through forms, but the real learning happens when blades cross. {SOLDIER_NAME} catches your eye and tilts his head toward the practice ring.

options.text: Accept the invitation. Keep it friendly.
options.resultText: Wooden blades crack together as you circle, testing each other's guards. Neither of you holds back, but nobody's trying to prove anything. You're both better for it.

options.text: Make it count. Fight like you mean it.
options.resultText: This one draws blood. You go at each other like there's a real grudge, and the watching soldiers fall quiet. When it's done, you're both breathing hard and sporting fresh bruises. Word will spread about this bout.

options.text: Not today. Shake your head and move on.
options.resultText: {SOLDIER_NAME} shrugs and finds another partner. No shame in knowing when to save your strength.

events.title: Endurance Training
events.setup: Run the camp perimeter until your lungs burn. Soldiers live and die by their stamina.

options.resultText: You run until your chest heaves and your legs scream for mercy. Each lap makes you harder to kill.
You decide to conserve your strength for when it matters.

events.title: Study Tactics
events.setup: Borrow a map, think about formations. Wars are won by those who think before they fight.

options.text: Study the maps and think about what you've seen.
options.resultText: You pore over old battle maps, considering terrain, formation, and timing. The patterns of war become clearer.
You set aside the scrolls. Practice beats theory anyway.

events.title: Practice Medicine
events.setup: Offer to help the surgeon with simple cases. Field medicine isn't pretty, but it saves lives.

options.resultText: You spend hours helping with wounds and illnesses. The surgeon grunts approval at your work. The patients appreciate a steady hand.
The surgeon has other helpers. Your hands stay clean.

events.title: Train the Men
events.setup: Take recruits through drills. They'll learn from your experience - assuming you don't break them first.

options.resultText: You put the recruits through their paces. They curse your name, but they'll fight better for it. The officers nod approvingly.
Training is someone else's responsibility today.

events.title: Combat Drill
events.setup: Request extra drill time with the sergeant. Hard work, but it sharpens your equipped weapon skills.

options.resultText: The sergeant works you hard, focusing on the weapon you carry. Your movements become more fluid, more deadly.
The drill grounds can wait.

events.title: Weapon Specialization
events.setup: Focus your training on the weapon you use most. Specialists kill faster than generalists.

options.text: Focus on mastering your main weapon.
options.resultText: Hours of focused practice. Your hands know this weapon like an extension of your body now.
Specialization can wait. Flexibility has its merits.

events.title: Lead Drill Practice
events.setup: Lead drill practice for younger soldiers. Teaching reinforces your own skills while building your reputation.

options.text: Take charge of junior soldiers' training.
options.resultText: You command the drill with authority. The young soldiers respond to your orders crisply. Officers watching from the sidelines look impressed.
Training others isn't your job today.

events.title: Join the Men
events.setup: Sit by their fire, share stories. Good for morale - theirs and yours.

options.text: Sit with the soldiers at their fire.
options.resultText: You share warmth and stories with your comrades. They appreciate an equal. The officers might not approve, but camaraderie is earned, not assigned.
You stay apart. Sometimes a soldier needs his own company.

events.title: Join the Drinking
events.setup: Someone's opened a cask. Join in? Drinking builds bonds but attracts attention.

options.text: Have a few drinks with the lads.
options.resultText: You share drink and laughter. The night blurs pleasantly. Tomorrow's headache will be worth tonight's camaraderie.

options.text: Drink deep and let the night take you.
options.resultText: You drink until the stars spin. They'll talk about this night. Whether that's good or bad remains to be seen.
You decline the drink. Clear heads have their value.

events.title: Seek the Officers
events.setup: Linger near the command tent, look useful. Ambition requires visibility.

options.text: Make yourself visible to the officers.
options.resultText: You find reasons to be near the command tent. The officers notice. The men notice too - and they don't always approve of climbers.
You stay with the men. Advancement can come naturally.

events.title: Keep to Yourself
events.setup: Sometimes solitude is worth more than company. Find a quiet spot away from the crowd.

options.text: Find somewhere quiet and be alone.
options.resultText: You find a quiet corner of camp and let your thoughts settle. The silence is a relief after the constant noise of military life.
You reconsider. The company of others has its merits.

events.title: Write a Letter Home
events.setup: Ink, paper, and memories of another life. Someone back home might appreciate hearing from you.

options.text: Write a reassuring letter, downplaying the dangers.
options.resultText: You craft careful words of safety and good fortune. No need to worry those waiting for you. The courier takes your letter with the next dispatch.
The truth flows onto the page - the fear, the boredom, the moments of strange pride. It feels good to be honest, even if the words might worry them.
You set aside the paper. Another time.

events.title: Confront Your Rival
events.setup: This has gone on long enough. There's someone in camp who's been making your life difficult. Time to settle it.

options.resultText: You find your rival and say what needs saying. The tension breaks - for better or worse, the air is cleared.

options.text: Settle it with fists, away from officers.
options.resultText: You trade blows behind the supply wagons. Win or lose, it's done. The men respect those who handle their problems directly.
You swallow your anger. Some battles aren't worth fighting.

events.title: Gamble (Low Stakes)
events.setup: Behind the supply wagons, a circle of soldiers hunches over a blanket. Dice clatter, coins change hands. Someone spots you watching and waves you over. "Room for one more, if your coin's good."

options.text: Toss in your copper and play for laughs. (10 gold stake)
options.resultText: The bones love you tonight. You sweep a modest pot toward yourself while the others groan and call for another round. Easy money, easy company.
options.failure_resultText: The dice turn cold. Your stake vanishes into other purses, but you share the groans and laughter with the rest. Cost of camaraderie.

options.text: Play carefully. Watch the odds. (10 gold stake)
options.resultText: You play tight, fold when the odds turn, push when they favor you. The pot's smaller, but it's yours. The others eye you with something between respect and annoyance.
options.failure_resultText: Even careful play can't beat a cold run. You walk away lighter, but at least you didn't chase your losses.

options.resultText: You wave them off and move on. Your purse stays full, but you miss the camaraderie of the circle.

events.title: Gamble (High Stakes)
events.setup: Real money. Real risk. The kind of game where fortunes change hands.

options.text: Put real money on the table. (50 gold stake)
options.resultText: Fortune favors the bold! You rake in a substantial pot. The losers eye you with new respect - or jealousy.
options.failure_resultText: The dice betray you. Your stake is gone, and then some. The winners smirk as you count what's left.

options.resultText: You keep your gold in your purse. Wisdom, or cowardice? Only you know.

events.title: Side Work
events.setup: Someone in camp needs labor. Pays decent - if you don't mind the sweat.

options.text: Put in extra labor for coin.
options.resultText: Hours of hard labor - hauling, digging, lifting. Your back aches, but your purse is heavier.
You pass on the extra work. Rest has value too.

events.title: Shady Deal
events.setup: A man knows a man who has something to sell. The goods look legitimate enough, but the price is suspiciously low.

options.text: Make the deal. Don't ask questions.
options.resultText: Coin changes hands in shadows. You don't know where the goods came from, and you don't ask. Profit is profit.
You tell the officers about the offer. They nod approvingly. The shady man disappears before anyone can question him.
You want no part of whatever this is. Clean hands are worth more than dirty coin.

events.title: Visit the Market
events.setup: Browse what the town has to offer. Supplies, luxuries, maybe something useful.

options.text: Spend some time browsing the stalls.
options.resultText: You wander the market, examining wares. The variety is a pleasant change from camp rations and military issue.
Duty calls louder than commerce.

events.title: Request an Audience
events.setup: The lord's banner hangs above the command tent. Guards stand watch, and officers come and go on important business. A common soldier doesn't just walk in—but your rank has earned you the right to petition, if you've something worth saying.

options.text: Remind the lord of your service. Speak of what you've done.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} hears you out, eyes sharp. When you finish, there's a pause—then a single nod. "I know your face now, soldier. Continue to serve well." It's not much, but from a lord, it's everything.

options.text: Humbly request an advance on wages. Debts press hard.
options.resultText: You explain your circumstances as briefly as you can. The lord's expression is unreadable, but he gestures to his steward. A purse of coins lands in your palm. "See that it's repaid in service." You're in debt now—of a different kind.

options.text: Ask for the chance to prove yourself in some special task.
options.resultText: The lord's eyebrow rises. Ambition, or foolishness? "I'll remember your eagerness, soldier. When something needs doing, perhaps I'll send for you." You've put your name forward. Now you must prove worthy of it.

options.text: Lose your nerve. This isn't the time.
options.resultText: You hover at the tent's edge, then turn away. The guards don't even glance at you. Better to wait for a stronger hand to play.

events.title: Volunteer for Duty
events.setup: Tell the sergeant you want extra work. Initiative is noticed - for better or worse.

options.resultText: {NCO_NAME} nods at your offer. Extra work finds you quickly. The officers appreciate initiative. Some of the men think you're showing off.
You stay quiet. No need to stand out more than necessary.

events.title: Request Leave
events.setup: Ask permission to visit town on your own time. Officers don't always approve, but it doesn't hurt to ask.

options.resultText: Permission granted, with conditions. You have until evening. Don't make them regret it.
options.failure_resultText: Request denied. The officer barely looks up. 'We march soon. Stay with the company.'

options.resultText: You decide not to ask. There will be other opportunities.

events.title: Listen to Rumors
events.setup: Keep your ears open around camp. Information is currency in any army.

options.text: Drift through camp, listening to talk.
options.resultText: You catch fragments of conversation - troop movements, noble politics, fears and hopes. Some of it might even be true.
You have better things to do than gossip.

events.title: Scout the Surroundings
events.setup: Take a walk beyond the camp perimeter. Know the land - it might save your life.

options.resultText: You explore the terrain around camp - paths, hiding spots, approaches. Knowledge that might matter when swords are drawn.
The camp is safe enough. No need to wander.

events.title: Check Supply Situation
events.setup: Ask the quartermaster how we're doing. Good to know before things get desperate.

options.resultText: The quartermaster shares the state of things - food stores, fodder, equipment. Information is power, even in small matters.

options.text: I'll find out when everyone else does.
options.resultText: Ignorance has its comforts. You'll know when you need to know.

events.title: Maintain Your Gear
events.setup: Oil, polish, sharpen. Keep it battle-ready. A soldier's gear is his life.

options.resultText: You work methodically - cleaning rust, sharpening edges, oiling leather. Your gear is ready for whatever comes.
Your gear will survive another day. Probably.

events.title: Visit the Quartermaster
events.setup: See what's available, maybe make a request. The quartermaster has what you need - for a price.

options.text: See what the quartermaster has in stock.
options.resultText: You browse the quartermaster's stores. Weapons, armor, supplies - all available for coin or requisition. Good to know what's possible.
Your current kit will serve. No need to spend coin you don't have.

events.title: Accept a Dangerous Wager
events.setup: The men are getting creative with boredom. {SOLDIER_NAME} grins at you across the fire. "Heard you've got brass ones. Bet you twenty denars you can't..." What follows is either incredibly dangerous or incredibly stupid. Possibly both.

options.text: "You're on." Stand up and prove it.
options.resultText: Your heart pounds, the men roar, and somehow—you pull it off. {SOLDIER_NAME}'s coins land in your palm while the camp erupts. They'll be telling this story for weeks. You'll be feeling it for just as long.
options.failure_resultText: Pride goes before the fall. You hit the ground hard, or burn yourself, or whatever fool thing you were attempting goes wrong. The men wince. The coin goes to {SOLDIER_NAME}. Your pride goes to the mud.

options.resultText: You turn the challenge around, stack the odds your way. It's still risky, but calculated. When you succeed, the winnings are sweeter—and you barely limp afterward.
options.failure_resultText: Even the clever approach goes wrong sometimes. You're out more coin and nursing new bruises. At least you tried to be smart about it.

options.text: "I've nothing to prove to you." Stay seated.
options.resultText: You shake your head. {SOLDIER_NAME} shrugs, calls you sensible or coward depending on the drink in him. Tomorrow, nobody will remember you turned it down. Or maybe they will.

events.title: Prove Your Courage
events.setup: Do something reckless to earn respect. The men respect courage - even the foolish kind.

options.resultText: You do something brave and stupid. The men cheer. The officers groan. Your body pays the price, but your reputation doesn't.
You decide against showboating. Real courage shows in battle, not in camp stunts.

events.title: Challenge Someone
events.setup: Call them out. Settle it properly, with witnesses. The old ways still matter.

options.resultText: Steel rings, blood flows. Win or lose, you've made a statement. The officers will hear about this - as will everyone else.

options.text: Some insults aren't worth dying for.
options.resultText: You let it pass. The smart choice, if not the satisfying one.
